meanings.definition: To shake or tremble, as from shock or fear.
meanings.sent1: The ground quaked beneath their feet during the earthquake.
meanings.sent2: She quaked with fear when she heard a loud noise in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy quaked in fear when it saw a big, scary shadow.
meanings.sent4: His voice quaked with emotion as he spoke about his difficult past.
meanings.sent5: The old building quaked as the wrecking ball struck its walls.

meanings.sent1: The quaked of the ground was felt throughout the city.
meanings.sent2: The sudden quaked of the train startled the passengers.
meanings.sent3: The quaked of the washing machine made the whole house vibrate.
meanings.sent4: The quaked of the volcano caused panic among the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The quaked of the thunder could be heard for miles around.
